comment.author: 54904823@N00
comment._content: Harry William "Hal" Krause (July 12, 1888 - October 23, 1940) was a Major League Baseball player. He was a pitcher over parts of five seasons (1908-1912) with the Philadelphia Athletics and Cleveland Naps. He led the American League in earned run average in 1909 while playing for Philadelphia. For his career, he compiled a 36-26 record, with a 2.50 ERA and 298 strikeouts. en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Harry_Krause
